titleStmt.title: By the Lord Deputy General, and General Governour of Ireland. A declaration for the good government of the Army. Tyrconnel, we having by our late declaration bearing date the 20th day of July last past; thought fit to make known what the clear pay coming to every private foot souldier by his Majesty's establishment is yearly, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at the Kings printinghouse on Ormonde-Key, and the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"Given at his Majesties castle of Dublin the 24th day of August 1688.".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
